intro: Pectis peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian pectis, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Peru. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss, while its flowers are yellow with prominent central disks. Pectis peruviana is often found in rocky soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
